Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Khan \Khan\, n. [Pers. & Tart. kh[=a]n.] [Also {kan}, {kaun}.] A king; a prince; a chief; a governor; -- so called among the Tartars, Turks, and Persians, and in countries now or formerly governed by them. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Khan \Khan\, n. [Per. kh[=a]n, kh[=a]nah, house, tent, inn.] An Eastern inn or caravansary. [Written also {kawn}.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Cham \Cham\ (k[a^]m), n. [See {Khan}.] The sovereign prince of Tartary; -- now usually written {khan}. --Shak. [1913 Webster]

khan n 1: a title given to rulers or other important people in Asian countries 2: an inn in some Eastern countries with a large courtyard that provides accommodation for caravans [syn: {caravansary}, {caravanserai}, {caravan inn}]
